info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 7:38PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Union and southeastern Tippah Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 737 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over New Albany, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Albany, Ripley, Keownville, Dumas, Cotton Plant, Shari, Union Hill, Graham, Martintown, Wallerville, Concord, Old Myrtle, Pumpkin Center, Molino, Clarysville, Baker, Locum, Parks, Beacon Hill and Smalco. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
